intro: Jaborosa longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered jaborosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its elongated, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Jaborosa longiflora is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
